newsitem.title: FRANCE: Air France ups ex-Paris-Chicago cargo rate.
newsitem.headline: Air France ups ex-Paris-Chicago cargo rate.

text.p: Air France said it will increase ex-Paris cargo rates to Chicago between 30 and 50 centimes per kg, effective May 15.
Air France last raised its Chicago rates in spring 1996.
"There is a very buoyant demand at present for non-consolidated, full-load traffic into the U.S. midwest, largely made up of capital goods and equipment," an Air France Cargo official told Reuters.
The French airline increased rates by similar amounts to New York, Los Angeles and Canada in March, the official said.
American Airlines raised its Paris-transatlantic cargo rates by between five and eight percent, effective May 5 while United Airlines increased its rates by seven percent from the same date.
In a new charter venture Air France has operated four to five Boejng 747-200F flights between Paris and Atlanta since the start of last month, the official added.

"A group of shippers are generating regular demand for full-load consignments and a longer term aim is to obtain traffic rights to operate scheduled freighter service on this route." - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
